intro: Psychotria humilis, commonly known as the lesser psychotria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect or sprawling shrub, reaching up to 1 meter in height. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy appearance. Psychotria humilis produces small, clustered white or pale green flowers, which are followed by small, red berries.
